2022-11-13T20:01:55Z: That's all from us after a breathtaking Brazil encounter. Thank you everyone for joining us - just one more remaining.
2022-11-13T20:01:12Z: Here's the report from the Brazilian Grand Prix: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-brazilian-gp-race-report/10399499/
2022-11-13T19:58:18Z: First time since the Bahrain GP that a Red Bull hasn't been on the podium, which shows you how this year has gone! Believe this is the first time Russell, Hamilton and Sainz have shared a podium together as a trio.
2022-11-13T19:55:12Z: Russell's facetiming Toto Wolff in the cooldown room, of course, Mercedes picks the race Wolff isn't in the building to win...
2022-11-13T19:46:44Z: The Sainz-Tsunoda safety car infringement is no longer being investigated.
2022-11-13T19:45:28Z: Could that late penalty for Gasly also come with some penalty points? Two more and Gasly gets a one-race ban remember...
2022-11-13T19:44:46Z: Meanwhile Gasly has been given a five-second penalty for speeding in the pitlane. He finished out of the points in 12th but has been dropped to 14th in the final results.
2022-11-13T19:43:39Z: An incident involving Sainz and Tsunoda during the safety car has been noted. We're still unsure what exactly went on there, but Tsunoda was definitely the odd one out in the pack.
2022-11-13T19:43:11Z: Perez is seventh ahead of Ocon, as Bottas and Stroll complete the top 10.
2022-11-13T19:42:55Z: Leclerc doesn't get his way and crosses the line in fourth, as Alonso grabs fifth. Verstappen was asked to let Perez back through - but didn't, and finishes in sixth.
2022-11-13T19:42:16Z: Lewis Hamilton completes the Mercedes 1-2, with Carlos Sainz completing the podium!
2022-11-13T19:41:50Z: And George Russell wins the 2022 Brazilian Grand Prix!
2022-11-13T19:41:03Z: Final lap! Russell's got a 1.6s advantage.
2022-11-13T19:39:48Z: Two to go, and Russell's got 1.2s over Hamilton. Sainz is a further 3.2s back, with Leclerc another 3.7s behind.
2022-11-13T19:37:54Z: Gasly and Schumacher trade overtakes on each other through the Senna Esses, so it means they remain 13th and 14th for now. They made the lightest of contact which appears to flick off some front wing from Gasly.
2022-11-13T19:34:23Z: Stroll moves into the final points place ahead of team-mate Vettel, potentially in the hope of going after Bottas who has struggled since the restart.
2022-11-13T19:34:02Z: Russell is just doing enough to keep Hamilton at bay, adding little bits to his lead. Meanwhile, Alonso is all over Perez like a rash, and gets the move done before Turn 4.
2022-11-13T19:32:53Z: Easy pickings for Leclerc, who surges down the inside of Turn 1 and claims fourth place. Perez looks like he's going to struggle against Alonso now too!
2022-11-13T19:32:15Z: Sainz clears Perez on lap 63, using the first DRS zone to draw close and then does the deed along the Reta Oposta. Perez is next going to be challenged by Leclerc.
2022-11-13T19:31:58Z: Verstappen gets two for the price of one, with a double dose of slipstream to get by Ocon and Bottas up the inside at Turn 1. Verstappen is up to seventh.
2022-11-13T19:31:00Z: What was most confusing about that restart was Tsunoda being in the middle of the pack and shown blue flags to let the pack lap him. Something went wrong there.
2022-11-13T19:30:38Z: DRS is now enabled, which will give Sainz a helping hand in his efforts to fight Perez. Russell's been able to keep Hamilton out of the one-second window, crucially.
2022-11-13T19:29:24Z: Sainz tries a move down the inside into Turn 1, Perez doesn't let the Spaniard through, and then baulks Sainz into Turn 3! Great racing on this restart.
2022-11-13T19:29:12Z: Alonso is on a charge, as a lap later he goes around the outside of Bottas to take sixth place. Wow.
2022-11-13T19:28:34Z: Alonso has now overtaken Ocon, assumingly due to those earlier team orders by Alpine, and is up to seventh.
2022-11-13T19:28:20Z: Perez has Sainz all over him, but the Ferrari can't mount an overtake into Turn 4. The Spanish driver has Leclerc right behind him too - what a recovery from the Monegasque after his early crash!
2022-11-13T19:27:41Z: Ocon does attack Vettel at the restart and gets by at Turn 1. Alonso has also cleared Vettel, so it is all going off!
2022-11-13T19:27:33Z: Russell drags out the restart process before he hits the gas as close to the start-finish straight as he can. He gets rolling, and Hamilton sticks with him as we get going again.
2022-11-13T19:25:57Z: Why hasn't Tsunoda been given the command to move out of the way? Sounds like any, not all cars with that command...
2022-11-13T19:24:50Z: The safety car will come in at the end of lap 59.
2022-11-13T19:23:34Z: Albon and Latifi, the lapped cars, have been allowed to unlap themselves to get the pack in order for the restart.
2022-11-13T19:22:36Z: Mind you, with Ocon directly in front of Alonso for this restart, who knows how that'll go given their clashes yesterday.
2022-11-13T19:21:49Z: A double DNF for McLaren is a hammer blow to its hopes on fighting Alpine in the constructors with both Ocon and Alonso in the points at present.
2022-11-13T19:18:34Z: Norris has stopped at a point on the track where there isn't a clear space to push his stricken McLaren behind the barriers, which is why race direction has gone from virtual to proper safety car. It looks to be the right call.
2022-11-13T19:16:45Z: Three track marshals are at the scene but cannot move the car, so a full safety car has been called now.
2022-11-13T19:16:29Z: Now here's interesting - Sainz is pitting for the soft tyre, and although he'll concede third to Perez, he'll have a good opportunity to get back ahead.
2022-11-13T19:14:59Z: Norris gets out of his McLaren, that's his race run, potentially due to damage he was carrying from his earlier clash with Leclerc.
2022-11-13T19:13:22Z: Ah, Norris has come to a halt at the side of the track. He's lost power.
2022-11-13T19:12:39Z: Russell then does a 1m13.996s on his first lap with the softs, as the leader seeks to restore his buffer over the rest of the field.
2022-11-13T19:12:16Z: Leclerc dives up the inside at Turn 1 to take seventh place off Vettel.
2022-11-13T19:11:54Z: Hamilton's hacked almost two seconds out of Sainz once up to speed, setting a 1m14.103s. That's quite quick.
2022-11-13T19:11:05Z: Verstappen also pits for the final time in this race, at least on schedule, and comes out on softs in 11th ahead of Norris.
2022-11-13T19:10:47Z: Russell comes in for his second stop, and also collects the soft tyre. He returns to the track ahead of Sainz, and he retains the lead.
2022-11-13T19:08:44Z: Leclerc is back into the points with a DRS-aided move on Gasly into Turn 1.
2022-11-13T19:08:05Z: Perez stops at the end of lap 47, and will take another set of mediums. Swift stop, as usual, from Red Bull.
2022-11-13T19:06:42Z: Bottas, Vettel and Norris pit together - seeing the Alfa Romeo driver come out in 10th, the Aston Martin in 11th and the McLaren in 16th.
2022-11-13T19:06:45Z: Bottas, Vettel and Norris all pit for the second time. Bottas remains ahead of Vettel, and takes the soft tyre - as Vettel goes for the medium.
2022-11-13T19:05:50Z: Sainz was perceptive enough earlier to ask if his race was with Perez - and received the affirmative. He's just 11s adrift as Perez doesn't have much pace in reserve.
2022-11-13T19:04:36Z: Well, Alonso has his chance, as Leclerc pits for the third time today and drops to 14th place.
2022-11-13T19:04:13Z: This time, Hamilton gets the run out of Juncao and Perez has little defence at the start of lap 45. The Brazilian fans are delighted - and Hamilton's up to second once more.
2022-11-13T19:03:55Z: Alonso gets by Schumacher to move into 11th place, but could points be a stretch with Leclerc, Norris and Verstappen ahead?
2022-11-13T19:03:28Z: Hamilton is on DRS now, but doesn't quite have the purchase to attack Perez into Turn 1. The Mexican also holds into Turn 4, but Hamilton looks like he just has to be patient...
2022-11-13T19:01:54Z: After a quick moan about being stuck behind Norris, Leclerc gets the move done around the outside at Turn 1 to take eighth place.
2022-11-13T19:00:20Z: Verstappen is back in the points, as he dives by Schumacher into Turn 1 to take 10th place. He's now five seconds off Leclerc who is tucked up behind Norris.
2022-11-13T18:58:39Z: Sainz is busy thinking about trying to undercut Perez and Hamilton now, and is told that he needs to keep up the pace to get the advantage.
2022-11-13T18:58:02Z: Norris vs Leclerc II is coming up, with the Ferrari driver closing in on the McLaren driver in a fight for eighth place.
2022-11-13T18:56:50Z: It's a 1m14.754s for Sainz, which is quite a mighty lap. There's some pace in that Ferrari, but the strategy's been a bit compromised by that earlier stop produced by a tear-off strip.
2022-11-13T18:55:47Z: Alonso isn't messing around after that slow stop and makes quick moves on Albon and  then Tsunoda to move up to 13th place.
2022-11-13T18:55:23Z: Mediums for Sainz then, who returns to the circuit just ahead of Bottas. Hamilton is now going to go after Perez, who is 4.6s ahead.
2022-11-13T18:53:44Z: Alonso has a miserably slow stop, which I'm sure will definitely help his mood. He had to wait for Gasly too - as Sainz comes in from third place.
2022-11-13T18:53:13Z: Hamilton's continuing to inch in on Sainz, and sits 2.2s behind now. If he can make the one-stop work, it'll be a very good effort, as Russell is just making sure his gap over Perez is solid.
2022-11-13T18:52:52Z: Norris (10th), Leclerc (12th) and Verstappen (15th) are going to keep the backmarker watchers busy. If that's your thing.
2022-11-13T18:51:46Z: Verstappen makes light work of Tsunoda to take 15th, while further up the road Leclerc gets by Schumacher to take 12th place.
2022-11-13T18:49:38Z: Stroll charges by Tsunoda for 14th, just as Verstappen arrives right behind the pair looking to impose himself on the situation.
2022-11-13T18:49:32Z: Striking distance in three laps, reckons the F1 battle forecast. Hamilton's shaved another two seconds off Sainz over the past two laps, and sits 3.8s behind as of the start of lap 34.
2022-11-13T18:47:53Z: Verstappen passes Albon at Turn 1 to take back 16th place. That's something nobody expected at the start of this race.
2022-11-13T18:47:27Z: Hamilton pumps in a 1m15.047s on his first lap on those mediums - which brings him to within 5.6s of Sainz in third.
2022-11-13T18:47:05Z: It was unseen by the TV cameras but Schumacher was also noted for a pitlane incident earlier, but no investigation for him at present, so it might have been related to the Alfa Romeo one.
2022-11-13T18:45:26Z: Hamilton stops at the end of lap 29, which gets him out into a comfortable fourth place behind Sainz. Alonso is some way behind in fifth, after the Alpine driver stopped early.
2022-11-13T18:45:01Z: A pitlane incident involving the Alfa Romeo team will be investigated after the race. That's a new one.
2022-11-13T18:44:25Z: Vettel duly gets by Gasly at Turn 1 to move up to eighth place. Double pain for AlphaTauri, as Tsunoda is passed by Leclerc for 14th at the same spot later on.
2022-11-13T18:43:02Z: On lap 28, Bottas dives by Gasly to take seventh place, with Vettel in close company having just pitted.
2022-11-13T18:42:07Z: After serving his penalty Norris has dropped back to 12th place and is three seconds off Zhou, who has just been overtaken by Ocon. This race is all action, I hope you are keeping up at home!
2022-11-13T18:41:19Z: Hamilton leads then, as Vettel comes in to stop from third place. Medium tyres for the Aston Martin driver.
2022-11-13T18:39:55Z: Verstappen also pitted in the same moment, serving his penalty, and he comes out in 17th behind Leclerc.
2022-11-13T18:38:55Z: Norris, Bottas and Ocon all pit together in a flying formation, and the McLaren driver comes out behind them all having served his five-second penalty.
2022-11-13T18:38:46Z: Russell takes the opportunity to pit as Perez has to wrestle against Bottas. That'll be enough for Russell to get up to speed, and stays ahead of Vettel.
2022-11-13T18:37:35Z: Scratch that, Perez is pitting - he bolts on a set of mediums and heads off on his merry way. He comes out behind behind Bottas, so that's hardly an ideal situation.
2022-11-13T18:37:26Z: Sainz continues his march up the order, getting by Ocon to take seventh at Turn 1.
2022-11-13T18:36:02Z: Hamilton's actively catching Perez now, as Russell is dropping the Red Bull.
2022-11-13T18:35:55Z: Leclerc makes a second stop to switch to the softs and while he only loses one place to Tsunoda he is now over one minute off the leaders. It's going to be a long afternoon for the Ferrari driver.
2022-11-13T18:34:14Z: A lap later Sainz repeats the same move up the inside at Turn 8, this time on Schumacher, to move up to eighth place.
2022-11-13T18:33:32Z: Sainz, free from his visor in brake duct woes, charges by Stroll at Turn 8 to take ninth place.
2022-11-13T18:32:29Z: Gasly is the next to pit and comes out right in front of Leclerc in 16th. Verstappen has caught the back of the pack and passed Latifi to get up to 13th place.
2022-11-13T18:30:15Z: Sainz pits, and grabs the soft tyre - perhaps finding the mediums less than ideal. The right-rear brake was smoking like a teenager behind some bikesheds, but it seems to have sorted itself out.
2022-11-13T18:28:31Z: Zhou pits to take fresh mediums and comes out in last place.
2022-11-13T18:28:21Z: Russell's opened up the gap to Perez to 2s at the start of lap 17, while Vettel springs a move on Norris to grab fifth place. Are you sure this man is retiring?
2022-11-13T18:26:48Z: Alonso is the first of the non-safety car or crash damage pitstoppers, taking on mediums and comes out in 17th place, in between Verstappen and Leclerc.
2022-11-13T18:25:47Z: Hamilton breezes past Norris for fourth, and he can now start catching Sainz.
2022-11-13T18:24:40Z: Hamilton gets the move done on Vettel now, and takes fifth place. Norris is next up, but a move at Descida do Lago is not on just yet.
2022-11-13T18:23:41Z: Norris has also been found the guilty party for his clash with Leclerc and he is also given a five-second penalty.
2022-11-13T18:22:53Z: Verstappen has been given a five-second penalty for his clash with Hamilton. That'll go down well.
2022-11-13T18:21:26Z: Both Verstappen and Leclerc are the fastest drivers on track, in free air at the back, but over 18s off the next on the road which is Albon.
2022-11-13T18:20:35Z: Norris is struggling with his steering into right-handed corners, likely a legacy of that crash with Leclerc. Vettel's about a second behind, as Hamilton is closing them down.
2022-11-13T18:19:44Z: Both the Verstappen vs Hamilton and Norris vs Leclerc incidents are under investigation with the stewards.
2022-11-13T18:19:04Z: Sainz puts the move on Norris to grab third place, while Russell is continuing to build a gap over Perez. It's 1.6s out in front.
2022-11-13T18:18:47Z: We've got a few recovery drives to keep track of now. Hamilton is on the move, taking Schumacher into Turn 1, and a lap later he gets by Gasly at the same spot to gain sixth place.
2022-11-13T18:17:17Z: It's lap 8 and Norris is defending hard from Sainz over third, as Russell tries to breakbuild over Perez in second. Vettel's on the back of Sainz too, as he's looking racey.
2022-11-13T18:17:14Z: Leclerc also pits after his Norris clash and is now in last place, with Verstappen in 17th. What a crazy start to this race!
2022-11-13T18:16:16Z: Both Verstappen and Hamilton are still in this race, as the Red Bull driver pits due to a damaged front wing while Hamilton continues on in eighth.
2022-11-13T18:16:14Z: And Leclerc hits the wall! Leclerc was battling with Norris for third place, and gets tipped into the wall at Turn 6 - but manages to get it out! Good save from the Ferrari driver!
2022-11-13T18:15:37Z: Russell hits the gas as late as he can - and Hamilton and Verstappen make contact as they battle into the first corner on the restart! Shades of 2021!
2022-11-13T18:12:42Z: The safety car is in this lap.
2022-11-13T18:11:59Z: Albon, who started on hard tyres, pits to take on fresh mediums. It is a free stop given the safety car is still in charge of the pack.
2022-11-13T18:10:51Z: The stewards will investigate that clash between Ricciardo and Magnussen after the race.
2022-11-13T18:10:12Z: The upshot of that crash for Haas is Magnussen's team-mate Schumacher is up to 10th, given both the drivers ahead of him crashed out. A small silver lining.
2022-11-13T18:06:53Z: It's all action immediately - great getaway from the Mercedes pair, while Norris on the softs was able to clear the medium-running Ferrari of Charles Leclerc.
2022-11-13T18:06:19Z: Ricciardo was looking for a way up the inside on Magnussen into Turn 8 but shut the door which led to the McLaren clipping the rear of the Haas. That spun around Magnussen and he was then collected by Ricciardo for good measure.
2022-11-13T18:04:25Z: Oh no! Ricciardo and Magnussen have clashed and they are both out of the race on the opening lap. The safety car is out!
2022-11-13T18:04:04Z: A good start for the Mercedes duo, as Verstappen immediately comes under fire from Perez and Norris!.
2022-11-13T18:02:28Z: The grid is forming up now - I hope we're in for a classic today.
2022-11-13T17:58:56Z: There's no bossa nova theme song - my disappointment is immeasurable and my day is ruined.
2022-11-13T17:58:25Z: That means our top four of Russell, Hamilton, Verstappen and Perez all begin on the soft boots.
2022-11-13T17:57:57Z: Tyre news: mediums for Leclerc, Sainz, Magnussen, Schumacher, Stroll, Alonso, Latifi and Tsunoda. Hards for Albon, softs for everyone else.
2022-11-13T17:55:03Z: We've got an air temp of around 24 degrees C as we approach the race. 10-percent risk of rain, but it's perfectly clement at the moment.
2022-11-13T17:48:46Z: The anthem had an...interesting approach to audio mixing. Livelier than last year, but a bit off kilter. I'm interested to see if we get a bossa nova F1 theme...
2022-11-13T17:46:12Z: 15 minutes until the cars get moving.
2022-11-13T17:36:15Z: As for Esteban Ocon, who suffered a fire at the end of a miserable sprint race, he takes an old power unit and thus starts 16th - ahead of team-mate Fernando Alonso.
2022-11-13T17:34:53Z: Pitlane shut, and all the cars are in their grid spots - except Yuki Tsunoda, who will be starting from the pitlane having taken new parts outside of parc ferme.
2022-11-13T17:23:52Z: The cars and their drivers are now making their way to the dummy grid, as the usual cast of celebrities and hangers-on indulge in the festivities.
2022-11-13T17:06:32Z: Carlos Sainz has taken a grid penalty for the full race, and thus starts from seventh - behind Lando Norris.
2022-11-13T17:02:59Z: Poleman Kevin Magnussen held the lead for the first lap, but was overtaken by Max Verstappen - who then began to struggle on the medium tyres, and fell prey to the eventual top three.
2022-11-13T17:02:17Z: We've had a race already as it's been one of those pesky sprint weekends, but it was a fairly action-packed 24 laps yesterday. George Russell won that, beating Carlos Sainz and Lewis Hamilton.
2022-11-13T17:00:59Z: Hello everyone, and welcome to our Autosport Live coverage of the Brazilian (or Sao Paulo, if you prefer actual race titles) Grand Prix. There's an hour to go until we get rolling at the Interlagos circuit.
